title: Surrounded Regions
description: Given an m x n matrix board containing 'X' and 'O', capture all regions that are 4-directionally surrounded by 'X'. A region is captured by flipping all 'O's into 'X's in that surrounded region.

brute-force.name: Brute Force
brute-force.description: Mark 'O's connected to border as safe, capture others.

steps.instruction: Define the function solve that takes board.

steps.hint: Get the number of rows and columns.

steps.instruction: Define DFS helper to mark safe 'O's as 'T'.
steps.placeholderCode:
def capture(r, c):
        if (r < 0 or c < 0 or r == rows or c == cols or
            board[r][c] != 'O'):
            return
        board[r][c] = 'T'
        capture(r + 1, c)
        capture(r - 1, c)
        capture(r, c + 1)
        capture(r, c - 1)
steps.hint: Recursive DFS. If out of bounds or not 'O', return. Mark current 'O' as 'T' (temporary safe) and recurse.
steps.solutionCode:
def capture(r, c):
        if (r < 0 or c < 0 or r == rows or c == cols or
            board[r][c] != 'O'):
            return
        board[r][c] = 'T'
        capture(r + 1, c)
        capture(r - 1, c)
        capture(r, c + 1)
        capture(r, c - 1)

steps.hint: Iterate through the board. If a cell is 'O' and on the border, start DFS to mark it and its connected 'O's as safe.
Final pass: change remaining 'O's (surrounded) to 'X', and revert 'T's (safe) back to 'O'.

steps.hint: Set the current board cell to 'T'.
